page.title: 13Inverkeithing Wildlife
page.content:
The area of the Forth Estuary is famous for it's ornithology. The Dalgety Bay / Inverkeithing area is especially interesting.
The area contains many different habitats _ mudflats,cliffs and shingle/rock beaches, often with trees to the water's edge.
Many birds winter here, including eider, redshanks, fieldfares, curlew, turnstone, sanderlings and redwings.
Seals also spend some time of the year here and can be seen basking on the rocks or swimming around,taking quite an interest in the humans around them !
